newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petron,FPHC in oil pipeline study.
newsitem.headline: Petron,FPHC in oil pipeline study.

text.p: Oil refiner Petron Corp and First Philippine Holdings Corp (FPHC) have started a feasibility study on an oil pipeline on the main island of Luzon, officials from both companies said on Thursday.

FPHC managing director Peter Garrucho told Reuters the study will look into the feasibility of setting up an oil pipeline from Petron's refinery in Bataan, south of Manila, to Bulacan, north of the capital. Garrucho said the study may also consider setting up an oil depot in Bulacan.
The study will also recommend how long the pipeline should be.
"There are ongoing discussions," Monico Jacob, Petron Corp chairman told Reuters without giving further details.
Garrucho said congestion and the difficulty of access into the Pandacan area in Manila, where Petron has an existing depot, led to talks on the pipeline study.
FPHC is the holding company of the Lopez family that has a stake in the Manila Electric Co, the country's biggest electricity distributor.
